climbs.name: The route that needs a name

content.description: Arete right of the "shimmy" problem. Sit down start, left hand on a good flake, right on a crystal edge. Pop up to the arete , then follow it out right and top out.
content.location: Downhill right arete on the Mushroom Boulder

content.description: Start on an obvious right hand crimp and left hand jug. Throw a high heal and move left across the lip working some foot trickery and awkward slopers into two small shark tooth crimps. Work your way out and to the left arete then top out with a fun mantel.
content.location: Walk to the back side of the mushroom boulder. It starts all the way right on an obvious crimp and jug, then moves left. There could be a further right start that will bump the grade up.

content.description: If walking up to Prow Boulder, just to the left, a small cluster boulder closest to the prow boulder on the back side has a low sloppy line about 25 ft long
